about.intro-title: A global movement to protect 30% of the world’s lands and waters by 2030.
about.section-definition-description: 30x30 is a global movement to protect 30% of the world’s lands and waters by 2030. This target has been formally adopted by nearly every country on earth, and ecosystem protection is being advanced and monitored by governments, NGOs, and local communities around the world.
about.section-problem-description-1: With only a few years left between now and 2030, the world is pushing hard to preserve our critical ecosystems. Biodiversity conservation is moving faster than ever, and a host of new organizations, tools, and campaigns are emerging every day.
about.section-problem-description-2: We created the 30x30 Progress Tracker to unify these information streams in a single location that provides an accessible entry point for getting informed and engaged in 30x30.
about.section-highlighted-1-title: We want visitors to be able to answer three questions.
about.section-highlighted-1-question-1: How is the world progressing toward 30x30?
about.section-highlighted-1-question-2: How much more of our lands and waters do we need to protect to reach the 30% goal?
about.section-highlighted-1-question-3: What resources are available to learn more about 30x30, get involved, and take action?
about.section-data-partners-description: We depend on the expertise and efforts of key data partners to power our maps and dashboards. Each of these datasets requires a tremendous amount of effort by our partners to create, curate, and maintain. High-quality, reliable, timely data are critical for assessing and measuring the effectiveness of ecosystem protections globally, which in turn is critical to ensuring the success of 30x30.
about.section-wdpa-title: The World Database on Protected Areas (WDPA)
about.section-wdpa-description: The World Database on Protected Areas (WDPA), maintained by Protected Planet, provides a comprehensive global inventory of the world's marine and terrestrial protected areas. The WDPA provides official protected area boundaries that have been self-reported by 245 countries around the world. WDPA data powers our statistics on total area protected per country and globally.
about.section-mpatlas-description: The Marine Protection Atlas (MPAtlas), which is produced by the Marine Conservation Institute, builds on the WDPA dataset to provide a science-based, independent assessment of the Stage of Establishment and Level of Protection per marine protected area (MPA). MPAtlas data powers our statistics on Level of Protection per MPA.
about.section-protectedseas-description: ProtectedSeas maintains the world’s largest database of regulatory information for MPAs, with information on over 21,000 marine and coastal protected areas around the world. ProtectedSeas data powers our Level of Fishing Protection (LFP) score, which describes the degree to which fishing activity has been restricted in MPAs.
about.section-future-objectives-description: This web portal was built with support from the Bloomberg Ocean Initiative, so we started by focusing on marine protection, with the goal of creating a one-stop entry point for getting engaged and informed on 30x30.
about.section-highlighted-2-title: Next, we're extending the Tracker to include protected area effectiveness.
about.section-highlighted-2-description: Our goal of creating a one-stop entry point for getting engaged and informed on 30x30.
about.section-team-and-funders-description: The 30x30 Progress Tracker is built by SkyTruth in collaboration with trusted partners, working to provide transparent, data-driven insights on global conservation progress. Our team combines technical expertise with a deep commitment to protecting biodiversity and ensuring accountability.

home.section-services-description: In partnership with Bloomberg Ocean Initiative, SkyTruth has developed an entry point for 30x30 stakeholders, enabling everyone to track the world’s progress toward 30x30, draw new protected areas, and find additional tools and organizations working for the protection of marine and terrestrial ecosystems.
home.section-impact-subsection-1-description-: Wildlife populations - mammals, birds, fish, and other species - have decreased by nearly 70% since 1970, with up to <a1>{threatenedSpeciesPercentage} species threatened with extinction</a1>. Habitat loss is the main driver of this ongoing extinction crisis. Today -- according to government figures -- only {protectedOceanPercentage} percent of the world’s ocean <a2>{protectedLandPercentage} percent of its land area</a2> are protected.
Protecting 30 percent of the world’s land and ocean habitats by 2030 will help these threatened species recover and survive, preserving them for future generations.
home.section-impact-subsection-2-description-: Earth’s climate and biodiversity are inextricably linked. A stable climate helps ecosystems thrive, and protected ecosystems help slow rising global temperatures and buffer us from the worst impacts of climate change, including floods, wildfires, and food insecurity.

Protecting 30 percent of Earths’ biodiversity will not only preserve vital ecosystems, it will keep massive amounts of carbon out of the atmosphere and give us a fighting chance to prevent and adapt to the worst effects of climate change.
home.section-impact-subsection-3-description-: From fisheries, to forests, to agriculture, to tourism, 30x30 envisions a world where critical habitats are sustained and protected, continuing to provide flood protection, pollinators for crops, and fish and other food resources for billions of people.
Protecting 30 percent of Earth’s lands and waters will help safeguard the resources we need for future generations to survive and flourish in a better world.

knowledge-hub.intro-title: Resources for 30x30 monitoring, planning and decision making.
knowledge-hub.intro-description: We intend to provide an entry point that is accessible and relevant to stakeholders at various levels, democratizing the conversation around 30x30 so everyone can participate in the process from a common starting point.

logos-grid.cea-description: Leads user discovery and stakeholder engagement
logos-grid.bloomberg-description: Provides the funding and support that made this tool a reality

homepage-intro.protect-land-and-ocean: Protect 30% of land and ocean by 2030
homepage-intro.current-total-protected-area: Current global land and inland waters protected area

homepage-link-cards.card-1-subtitle: A high-level, interactive map and dashboard tracking conservation progress at global and national scales.
homepage-link-cards.card-1-description: The Progress Tracker enables users to understand global and national level habitat protection progress at a glance, including (1) How much of our lands and waters are protected, and (2) How effective those protections are, using assessment data from MPAtlas and ProtectedSeas. The platform not only enables users to see the location of currently protected and conserved areas, but also allows them to overlay the location of key habitats and areas recommended by expert analysts as critical areas to protect for biodiversity.
homepage-link-cards.card-2-subtitle: A lightweight, interactive scenario building and visualization tool for evaluating conservation and protection scenarios.
homepage-link-cards.card-2-description: The Conservation Builder enables users to view existing protected areas, draw potential protected areas, and dynamically illustrate the effects of proposed regions on progress toward 30x30. It also provides easy access to data about key habitat locations and research-based conservation recommendations to help identify key biodiversity areas to be considered for protection.
homepage-link-cards.card-3-subtitle: A navigation hub guiding users toward other helpful 30x30 resources.
homepage-link-cards.card-3-description: The Knowledge Hub will link users to other 30x30-focused organizations and efforts, making it easier for stakeholders at all levels to discover and make use of advanced resources for monitoring, planning, and decision making.

map-sidebar-main-panel.proportion-habitat-within-protected-area: Proportion of Habitat within Protected and Conserved Areas
map-sidebar-main-panel.custom-area-description: Activate more layers for additional contextual information about your custom area conservation scenario.
map-sidebar-main-panel.how-to-draw: How to draw a custom area on the map, using the drawing functionality?
map-sidebar-main-panel.step-1-description: Click on the Draw a shape button located below.
map-sidebar-main-panel.step-2-description: Start drawing on the map by clicking. Each click adds an anchor point. All sides of the polygon are connected through anchor points.
map-sidebar-main-panel.step-3-description: Close the polygon you drew by clicking on the first anchor point you added at the beginning or by double clicking on the last anchor point.
map-sidebar-main-panel.empty-custom-region: Add countries to your Custom Region by selecting them on the map and clicking the <addIcon></addIcon> icon, or by clicking on <searchIcon></searchIcon> Change Location and choosing from the list of countries in the Custom Region tab.
map-sidebar-main-panel.add-country-custom-region: Add Countries to Your Custom Region to See Stats
map-sidebar-main-panel.overlapping-eez-explainer: The following countries in your Custom Region have some overlapping EEZ boundaries with at least one other country. This could mean that some statistics are double counted:
